unnormalised: Okay, here's an article about League Transfers, with the requested parameters:
normalised: the transfer window drama: who is going where in the I-League?

unnormalised: The Transfer Window Drama: Who's Going Where in the I-League?
normalised: the Indian football season is heating up, and you know what that means – the transfer window is buzzing like bees around jalebi! every team, from Mohammedan Sporting in Kolkata to RoundGlass Punjab F C, is trying to bolster their squad, hoping to clinch that coveted I-League title or, at the very least, avoid relegation.

unnormalised: The Indian football season is heating up, and you know what that means – the transfer window is buzzing like bees around jalebi! Every team, from Mohammedan Sporting in Kolkata to RoundGlass Punjab FC, is trying to bolster their squad, hoping to clinch that coveted I-League title or, at the very least, avoid relegation.
normalised: rumours are flying thick and fast, fuelled by chai-stall gossip and whispered conversations outside Salt Lake Stadium. will Sunil Chhetri make a sensational return to Mohun Bagan? probably not, but you never know! the unpredictability is half the fun.

unnormalised: Rumours are flying thick and fast, fueled by chai-stall gossip and whispered conversations outside Salt Lake Stadium. Will Sunil Chhetri make a sensational return to Mohun Bagan? Probably not, but you never know! The unpredictability is half the fun.
normalised: one confirmed move that sent ripples through the footballing community was Arjun Singh's transfer from Aizawl F C to Churchill Brothers for a reported rupee three hundred thousand. a hefty sum for a promising young defender, but Churchill seem to be serious about their ambitions this year. Arjun, originally from a small village near Varanasi, has reportedly also acquired a new two B H K apartment measuring approximately eight hundred square feet near Margao. smart move, Arjun!

unnormalised: One confirmed move that sent ripples through the footballing community was Arjun Singh's transfer from Aizawl FC to Churchill Brothers for a reported Rs. 30 Lakhs. A hefty sum for a promising young defender, but Churchill seem to be serious about their ambitions this year. Arjun, originally from a small village near Varanasi, has reportedly also acquired a new 2BHK apartment measuring approximately 800 sq ft near Margao. Smart move, Arjun!
normalised: meanwhile, whispers suggest that East Bengal is eyeing a Nigerian striker, currently playing in the Saudi Arabian league. they're hoping his experience and goal-scoring prowess will fill the void left by their departed star forward. the transfer fee being discussed is astronomical - supposedly nearing rupee one crore, plus bonuses. that's enough to buy a small haveli in Rajasthan!

unnormalised: Meanwhile, whispers suggest that East Bengal is eyeing a Nigerian striker, currently playing in the Saudi Arabian league. They're hoping his experience and goal-scoring prowess will fill the void left by their departed star forward. The transfer fee being discussed is astronomical - supposedly nearing Rs. 1 Crore, plus bonuses. That's enough to buy a small haveli in Rajasthan!
normalised: Doctor Amit Patel, sports analyst at the Indian Institute of Management, Ahmedabad, believes that strategic transfers are key to success. "it's not just about splashing the cash," he says. "teams need to identify players who fit their system and can contribute to the team's overall philosophy. think of it like finding the right spices for a perfect biryani – you need the right blend!"

normalised: the other big talking point is the potential loan move of Ishan Pandita from F C Goa to Chennai City F C. Pandita, a talented midfielder, hasn't seen much game time lately and a loan spell could revitalize his career. it would certainly give Chennai City a much-needed boost in midfield.
